name: RO-ScintillationCounter
title: Scintillation Counter Cosmic Ray Telescope
description:
The Scintillation Counter Cosmic Ray Telescope is a combination of three scintillators giving both the energy (E) of a charged particle and its rate of energy loss (dE/dx) in the scintillators. It is measuring the mass and energy spectra of primary and solar cosmic rays and electrons.
Level 2 Cosmic Ray Experiment Device. Can gather 100% of Cosmic Ray Science.

name: science_module
title: Early Film Camera
description: The Early Film Camera is used to take photographs of Earth from space. This is a very early camera and lacks resolution in the images. Historically, these were flown on V-2 Rockets.\nThe photos cannot be transmitted and must be returned for further study. Level 1 Photograph Experiment. Can gather 20% of Photography Science. You can store up to 3 different photos before you need to return them to Earth.

name: sensorAtmosphere
title: Gas Chromatograph-Mass Spectrometer (GC/MS)
description: The Gas Chromatograph-Mass Spectrometer (GC-MS) is an analytical instrument used for identification of multiple different substances in a selected gas sample, capable of detecting even trace amounts of them. Ideal of analyzing the atmospheric composition of unknown environments. Mass spectrometry is an analytical technique that ionizes chemical species and sorts the ions based on their mass-to-charge ratio. Historically, these simple experiments were flown on interplanetary crafts including the Mars Viking Lander and Cassini.\nLevel 4 Mass Spectrometry Experiment Device. Can gather 100% of Mass Spectrometry Science.
